data.title: 50 Best Honors Colleges – 2024
data.meta_description: College Transitions is a smarter approach to college admission. College Transitions offers a data-driven menu of services that help students identify good-fit schools, maximize their admission prospects, and make the most of their college investment.
data.text:
May 9, 2024

Honors colleges can be a cost-effective and highly rewarding undergraduate experience for top-notch students. In the best-case scenario, you can enjoy all the benefits of a large university (research opportunities, athletics, and a diverse student body) while still benefiting from an intimate, rigorous, and individualized experience usually reserved for students attending elite liberal arts colleges. Given the proliferation of honors-related programming at colleges across the U.S., we wanted to uncover which institutions, in particular, stood out from the rest. Our list of the 50 Best Honors Colleges highlight’s the nations’s strongest and most comprehensive honors programs, while hopefully giving you the info needed to determine which program is ultimately best for you.

Best Honors Colleges Methodology

In order to evaluate and subsequently rank the hundreds of honors programs and colleges currently in existence within U.S. higher education, we relied on three general factors–namely those encompassing selectivity, benefits offered, and program rigor–and for which each institution/program was scored. Scores were then standardized, weighted, and totaled.

Selectivity Score (25%) – Accounts for the average SAT/ACT scores and high school GPA of incoming students, the university’s overall acceptance rate, and the percentage of a university’s student body enrolled in the honors program.

Benefits Score (50%) – Accounts for housing and living-learning opportunities made exclusively available to honors students, access to priority registration, undergraduate research offerings, the availability of travel and research grants, and support for applications to national and other competitive scholarships/fellowships.

Rigor Score (25%) – Accounts for the number of honors credits enrolled students are required to take, whether a thesis or culminating project is offered and required, and the minimum GPA honors students must maintain to remain in the program and to ultimately graduate with honors distinction.

Below, is a list of the honors/colleges programs with the highest total scores.

#1 Best Honors College

University of Georgia (Morehead Honors College)

Athens, GA

About: The Jere W. Morehead Honors College began in 1960 with a handful of classes and about 40 students and now serves more than 2,800 undergraduates each year—including 550 incoming first-year students for fall 2023. Honors students can choose any degree program at UGA, which has 170-plus majors and academic programs. Benefits include small class sizes, internship programs, travel-study funding, research opportunities, faculty connections, scholarship support, early registration, and access to unique alumni networking opportunities.

Professional Outcomes: 96% of the Class of 2022 was employed or continuing their education six months after graduation. Popular employers include Accenture, PricewaterhouseCoopers, the Walt Disney Company, and Deloitte. Salaries vary between colleges; engineering grads had a median starting salary of $65k while journalism and communication grads reported a $50k median. In 2022, 24% of graduates enrolled directly into a graduate/professional degree program, with the most commonly attended schools including Columbia, Duke, Emory, Georgia Tech, Penn, and UVA.

Honors Enrollment: 2,800

Honors % (of student body): 9%

SAT (Average): 1506

ACT (Average): 34

Required Honors Credits/Courses: 9 courses

Senior Thesis: Offered

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

#2 Best Honors College

Penn State University (Schreyer Honors College)

University Park, PA

About: The Schreyer Honors College is widely and consistently recognized as one of the top undergraduate programs in the United States. With access to distinguished faculty, smaller honors class sizes, and individualized support, the honors experience at Penn State offers highly motivated high school students a rigorous undergraduate academic experience that combines all of the resources of one of the country’s largest research institutions with all the benefits of a small liberal arts college.

Professional Outcomes: By graduation, 70% of Nittany Lions have found their next employment or graduate school home. 98% of College of Business grads are successful within three months of exiting, flocking in large numbers to stellar finance, accounting, consulting, and technology firms. Hundreds of alumni work at Citi, Salesforce, and Meta, and more than 500 currently work at each of IBM, Deloitte, PwC, Amazon, EY, JPMorgan Chase, Microsoft, Google, and Oracle. 75% of 2022 grads employed full-time earned starting salaries greater than $50k.

Honors Enrollment: 1,800

Honors % (of student body): 4.3%

Required Honors Credits: 35

Senior Thesis: Required

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

#3 Best Honors College

Texas A&M University (University Honors)

College Station, TX

About: The University Honors Program focuses on personal, professional, and intellectual development through layering high-impact experiences. The central goal of an Honors education at Texas A&M is to provide students who thrive on challenge and enrichment the opportunity to realize their full potential of personal, professional, and intellectual growth. Benefits include close contact with accomplished faculty, collaborative learning with other motivated students, small, discussion-based seminars and/or one-on-one instruction, knowledge production through individual research experiences, and engagement with internships, foreign study, and campus or community service.

Professional Outcomes: On graduation day, 54% of students had already received at least one job offer and 22% were heading to graduate/professional school. Many Aggies go on to work at major oil, tech, and consulting firms; more than 500 are employed at each of ExxonMobil, Halliburton, Chevron, EY, Amazon, Microsoft, Intel, Accenture, and PWC. Starting salaries were strong—on average, College of Engineering grads made $80k and College of Agriculture & Life Sciences grads netted $54k. A&M is also the eighth-largest producer of law students in the entire country.

Honors Enrollment: 2,000

Honors % (of student body): 3.5%

SAT (Minimum): 1360

ACT (Minimum): 28

Required Honors Credits: 30

Senior Thesis: Required

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

#4 Best Honors College

University of Connecticut Honors Program

Storrs, CT

About: The University of Connecticut Honors Program was instituted nearly sixty years ago and has awarded Honors designations to almost 9000 UConn graduates. Approximately 2,300 students are currently enrolled in this vibrant community across all UConn’s campuses in majors spanning all undergraduate schools and colleges. The Honors Program provides unique access to undergraduate research, honors-specific courses across the curriculum, dedicated Honors faculty advisors, education abroad opportunities, and other special programs and co-curricular opportunities.

Professional Outcomes: 90% of the Class of 2022 experienced a positive outcome (job, grad school, military, volunteer position) within six months of earning their degrees. Among the 59% who found employment, the largest numbers landed at Aetna, Cigna, PwC, The Hartford, Travelers, and Raytheon Technologies; the median starting salary was $62,400. Massive numbers of alumni are employed by Pratt & Whitney, Pfizer, IBM, and Deloitte. 30% of 2022 graduates immediately entered a graduate or professional program, with many choosing to stay at UConn.

Honors Enrollment: 2,300

Honors % (of student body): 12.1%

Required Honors Credits: 24

Senior Thesis: Required

Priority Registration: Required

Honors Housing: Yes

#5 Best Honors College

Arizona State University (Barrett, The Honors College)

Tempe, AZ

About: Barrett, The Honors College at Arizona State University is a highly regarded, residential college for academically outstanding undergraduates. As the honors college on all four campuses of the nation’s largest public university, Barrett offers the best of both worlds – a highly-personalized academic experience backed by the resources and expansive opportunities of a Research I university. A $12 million endowment exclusively supports honors students and their projects. Barrett students can enrich their experience in many ways through unique honors-only opportunities including study abroad and globally-focused programs, undergraduate research and internships, social and cultural events, and leadership and service initiatives.

Professional Outcomes: A healthy 83% percent of ASU graduates looking for work are employed within six months of earning their degrees. The median salary for an ASU grad is roughly $55,000. Among the school’s top fifty employers are Amazon, Apple, Intel, The Vanguard Group, and Walt Disney Company. Approximately one-fifth of recent grads enrolled in graduate school. Similar to employment, the size and scope of the university lead to many graduate pathways. Many grads continue at ASU itself, but some continue at various prestigious institutions.

Honors Enrollment: 7,200

Honors % (of student body): 11%

Required Honors Credits: 36

Senior Thesis: Required

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

Average Class Size: 15

#6 Best Honors College

Miami University Honors College

Oxford, OH

About: The mission of the Miami University Honors College is to produce citizen scholars, who emerge from their honors education equipped not only with a lifelong love of learning, but also a lifelong commitment to use their talents, interests, and ambitions to advance the common good. MU’s Honors College offers unique courses, study abroad programs, opportunities for faculty mentorship, and a supportive residential experience in which students thrive. Honors College students complete rigorous, scholarly curricular requirements and produce an Honors Senior Project that meets the quality of publishable or professional work by the time that they graduate.

Professional Outcomes: The overall success rate for the Class of 2022 was 99%, roughly the same as for the previous two cohorts. Fifty-five percent of recent Miami grads were employed and by mid-career, alumni enjoy a median salary of $118k. Over one-quarter of recent grads elected to continue their education in graduate or professional school. Miami boasts a strong premed program that resulted in 63% of medical school applicants gaining acceptance over the last four years.

Honors Enrollment: 1,930

Honors % (of student body): 11.4%

SAT (Average): 1400

ACT (Average): 31.5

Required Honors Credits: 40

Senior Thesis: Required

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

Average Class Size: 24

#7 Best Honors College

University of South Carolina Honors College

Columbia, SC

About: South Carolina Honors College combines the resources of a top-tier research university and the feel of a small liberal arts college. Honors students have access to nearly 600 honors courses offered each year, special campus housing, unique research projects, study abroad, service learning and internships. Students are also students, supported by the National Fellowships and Scholar Programs office, and have a strong record of success in the Rhodes, Marshall, Truman, Goldwater, Fulbright and many other prestigious competitions.

Professional Outcomes: 79% of recent grads landed at their next destination within six months with an average starting salary of over $55,000. Within the School of Business, 87% of 2023 grads were employed within three months and the average starting salary was $69k. Top employers of recent classes included KPMG, IBM, Aramark, Bank of America, Vanguard, PwC, and Marriot. The majority of those continuing their studies in a graduate/professional degree program did so at the University of South Carolina; other popular landing spots are Duke and Wake Forest.

Honors Enrollment: 2,300

Honors % (of student body): 8.4%

SAT (Average): 1430-1520

ACT (Average): 32-34

Required Honors Credits: 45

Senior Thesis: Required

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

Average Class Size: 16

#8 Best Honors College

Purdue University (John Martinson Honors College)

West Lafayette, IN

Academic Highlights: The John Martinson Honors College offers a dynamic and rigorous curriculum designed to challenge and inspire enrolled students. Through immersive learning curriculum, undergraduate research opportunities, and real-world experiences, With small class sizes, personalized mentorship, and a network of alumni, friends and industry connections, Martinson aims to cultivate critical thinking, creativity, and problem-solving skills that prepare honors students for the challenges of the modern world. Martinson also supports new programmatic initiatives which promote undergraduate research, scholarship and creative activity, leadership and professional development, global and community engagement, and innovative pedagogies.

Professional Outcomes: Shortly after receiving their diplomas, 70% of 2022 grads headed to the world of employment while 24% headed to graduate/professional school. The top industries entered by grads in recent years are (1) health care, pharmaceuticals, and medical devices; (2) finance, insurance, and consulting; (3) manufacturing and machinery; (4) airline, aviation, and aerospace. Companies employing the greatest number of recent alumni were Amazon, Deloitte, PepsiCo, Labcorp, Lockheed Martin, and Microsoft. The average starting salary was $68k across all degree programs.

Honors Enrollment: 3,263

Honors % (of student body): 8.6%

SAT (Average): 1388

ACT (Average): 31

Required Honors Credits: 24

Senior Thesis: Required

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

Average Class Size: 18

#9 Best Honors College

University of Virginia Echols Scholars Program

Charlottesville, VA

About: Because of their deep curiosity and intrinsic motivation, Echols Scholars enjoy flexibility in their academic requirements in order to pursue their individual scholarly interests. Scholars are granted an exemption from the General Education requirements within the College of Arts & Sciences while also receiving special access to priority enrollment, honors-only advising resources, and honors-only housing. Since the Echols Scholars Program is founded upon the principle of academic motivation and intellectual creativity, students in the program have the opportunity to define a course of study that will permit attainment of academic and career goals that fall outside existing majors or interdisciplinary programs within the college.

Professional Outcomes: Upon receiving their degree, 95% of the Class of 2022 immediately joined the workforce–with an average starting salary of $90k–or headed directly to graduate school. The most popular industries were internet & software, higher education, and management consulting. Capital One (85), Deloitte (46), Amazon (38), and Bain & Co. (26) scooped up the greatest number of 2022 grads. UVA itself was the most popular grad school destination followed by Columbia, Virginia Commonwealth University, and Johns Hopkins.

Honors Enrollment: 800

Honors % (of student body): 4.6%

Senior Thesis: Recommended

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

#10 Best Honors College

University of Michigan (LSA Honors)

Ann Arbor, MI

About: Michigan’s LSA Honors Program is a four-year program that provides an especially rich and challenging set of academic offerings to talented and highly motivated students in the College of Literature, Science, and the Arts. Through Honors courses, research with faculty, and a vigorous intellectual community, this highly-ranked academic program enables students to identify their intellectual interests and to pursue them deeply. During their first two years, students will participate in an Honors Core course from the areas of Natural Science (NS), Social Science (SS), and the Humanities (H). In their final two years at U-M, students who graduate with Honors all participate in a capstone project by writing a thesis in their area of major.

Professional Outcomes: Within three months of graduating, 89% of LSA grads are employed full-time or in graduate school, with healthcare, education, law, banking, research, nonprofit work, and consulting being the most popular sectors. Within three months, 99% of Ross grads are employed with a median salary of $90k. Top employers include Goldman Sachs, Deutsche Bank, EY, Morgan Stanley, PwC, Deloitte, and Amazon. Within six months, 96% of engineering grads are employed (average salary of $84k) or in grad school. General Motors, Ford, Google, Microsoft, Apple, and Meta employ the greatest number of alumni.

Honors Enrollment: 2,000

Honors % (of student body): 6.1%

Senior Thesis: Required

Priority Registration: No

Honors Housing: Yes

#11 Best Honors College

University of Pittsburgh (Frederick Honors College)

Pittsburgh, PA

About: In 1986, the University of Pittsburgh established an honors college to meet the special academic and co-curricular needs of students who sought to elevate their undergraduate experiences. Honors students can enhance their Pitt undergraduate degree in any major by choosing one of our distinctive programs–the Honors Distinction, the Honors Degree, and the Bachelor of Philosophy (BPhil)–all while having access to a dedicated advisor within the Frederick Honors College as as well as access to unique honors courses and undergraduate research opportunities.

Professional Outcomes: Within a few months of graduating, 94% of 2022 grads entered full-time employment or full-time graduate or professional school. Engineering, nursing, business, and information sciences majors had 73-86% employment rates while other majors tended to flock to graduate school in large numbers. Employers scooping up the highest number of grads in one recent year included the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center (170), PNC (57), BNY Mellon (36), and Deloitte (19). Median starting salaries fluctuated between $37k-65k depending on major.

Honors Enrollment: 2800

Honors % (of student body): 14.05%

Average SAT: 1501

Average ACT: 34

Required Honors Credits: 24

Senior Thesis: Offered

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

#12 Best Honors College

University of Vermont (Leahy Honors College)

Burlington, VT

Academic Highlights: Leahy Honors College makes available special programs, courses, and student activities. It also offers honors students academic mentoring and provides opportunities for leadership, community participation, and academic achievement. The Honors College also oversees the office of Fellowships, Opportunities, and Undergraduate Research, which advises on undergraduate research opportunities, coordinates the annual UVM Student Research Conference, and gives access to advising on national fellowship and scholarship opportunities.

Professional Outcomes: Over the last three years, graduates have enjoyed a 94% success rate. Alumni earned an average starting salary of $49,909 during that span of time. Roughly 90% of grads stated that their current job was related to their career goals. Top employers included Mass General Hospital, Beta Technologies, and GlobalFoundries. Looking at the Class of 2022 who enrolled in advanced degree programs, common universities included Northeastern, BU, Simmons, NYU, and Cornell.

Honors Enrollment: 950

Honors % (of student body): 8%

Required Honors Credits: 21-22

Senior Thesis: Required

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

#13 Best Honors College

Clemson University Honors College

Clemson, SC

About: The Honors College at Clemson University, which combines the strengths of a public, land-grant university with those of a highly selective small college. Honors students have the ability to engage in cutting-edge research with some of the leading faculty in the country. And they are able to do so while getting to know their professors in small classes and in other settings. Honors students can also take advantage of a wide range of classes in the sciences and engineering, education, the arts, humanities, and the social sciences, and can also take specially designed, intensive seminars.

Professional Outcomes: Within six months of graduation, 92% of 2022 grads had already entered the working world or were pursuing a graduate degree. The top employers of newly-minted diploma holders include Michelin, Amazon, Vanguard, and Wells Fargo. Computing and Applied Sciences reported a median starting salary of $62,000. College of Business graduates enjoyed median earnings of $60,000. Of the 19% of recent graduates directly entering grad school, the largest number retained their Tiger stripes by continuing their studies at Clemson.

Honors Enrollment: 1,800

Honors % (of student body): 8%

SAT (Average): 1446

Required Honors Credits: 18

Senior Thesis: Offered

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

Average Class Size: 15

#14 Best Honors College

University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill (Honors Carolina)

Chapel Hill, NC

Academic Highlights: Honors Carolina is a rigorous, interdisciplinary academic program designed for students who are eager to explore beyond their immediate academic concentrations and anticipated career trajectories. Benefits include preferred registration, access to honors-only internships and study abroad opportunities, dedicated advisors, personalized coaching, designated housing, and alumni networking.

Professional Outcomes: Six months after leaving Chapel Hill, 97% of 2022 grads had entered employment, military service, or graduate school. Among the for-profit companies that hire the most graduates are Wells Fargo, IBM, Cisco, Deloitte, EY, Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Oracle, McKinsey & Company, and Goldman Sachs. In the nonprofit sector, a large number of alumni are employed by AmeriCorps, NIH, Teach for America, and the Peace Corps. The average starting salary is $70,619. 18% of 2022 grads enrolled directly in graduate/professional school.

Honors Enrollment: 1,900

Honors % (of student body): 9.4%

SAT (Average): 1463

ACT (Average): 33

Average Class Rank: Top 5%

Required Honors Credits: 27

Senior Thesis: Offered

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

#15 Best Honors College

Ohio State University (University Honors Program)

Columbus, OH

About: The University Honors Program promotes the intellectual and personal development of undergraduate students through an enrich ed academic experience and integration of curricular and co-curricular programming. Honors students can take advantage of Honors status in 200+ majors across campus; choose from more than 350 sections of Honors classes, averaging fewer than 25 students each; pursue original research and write an Honors thesis under the guidance of a faculty member; live in three designated Honors learning communities; and receive university-level priority course scheduling to meet your Honors requirements.

Professional Outcomes: Upon receiving their diplomas, 56% of Class of 2022 graduates were entering the world of employment while 17% were already accepted into graduate or professional school. Hordes of Buckeyes can be found at many of the nation’s leading companies. More than 2,000 alumni work for JPMorgan Chase, more than 1,000 are employed by Amazon, and more than 600 work for Google and Microsoft. Of the grads who directly matriculate into graduate or professional school, many continue in one of OSU’s own programs.

Honors Enrollment: 4,100

Honors % (of student body): 8.9%

Required Honors Credits: 18

Senior Thesis: Required

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

Average Class Size: 20

#16 Best Honors College

University of Washington Interdisciplinary Honors Program

Seattle, WA

About: The Interdisciplinary Honors curriculum merges sciences and humanities to fulfill UW general education requirements; primarily through small, seminar-style classes. Experiential learning requirements guarantee development outside of the classroom while Honors’ portfolio practice strengthens writing, reflection, and synthesis across disciplines. Honors students benefit from unique opportunities such as small, engaging Interdisciplinary Honors classes that teach new ways of thinking & learning; reflection to promote deliberate educational choices; engagement in international study, community service, leadership and research; close contact with professors & community scholars; unique honors study abroad opportunities.

Professional Outcomes: Within months of graduation, 73% of Class of 2022 grads were employed and 17% were continuing their education. The most popular employers of the Class of 2022 included Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Boeing, and KPMG. Across all living alumni, 6,000+ work for Microsoft, and 4000+ work for each of Boeing and Amazon. Of those headed to graduate/professional school, just over half remain in state, mostly at UW itself. Large numbers of 2022 grads also headed to Columbia, Johns Hopkins, and USC.

Honors Enrollment: 1,300

Honors % (of student body): 3.5%

Required Honors Credits: 39-48

Senior Thesis: Offered

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

Average Class Size: 25

#17 Best Honors College

Florida Atlantic University (Wilkes Honors College)

Jupiter, FL

Academic Highlights: The Harriet L. Wilkes Honors College of Florida Atlantic University is the nation’s only university-affiliated, free-standing honors college. Located in Jupiter, FL on the John D. MacArthur campus of Florida Atlantic, this close-knit, residential, highly-selective liberal arts and sciences college offers a distinctive all-honors curriculum and is surrounded by world-renowned scientific research institutes, where undergraduates benefit from unique access to research internships.

Professional Outcomes: With a 68% job placement rate, many students have positive post-graduate outcomes. Currently, nearly 3,000 alumni work at Florida Atlantic itself while just over 1,000 are employed by Broward County Public Schools. 200+ alumni work for each of Broward College, Palm Beach State College, Broward Health, and NextEra Energy. Many can also be found at major corporations such as Amazon, Microsoft, Hilton, Marriott, and Salesforce. Sector-wise, most alumni work in business development followed by operations, education, and sales.

Honors Enrollment: 600

Honors % (of student body): 2.5%

SAT (Average): 1285

ACT (Average): 29

Required Honors Credits/Courses: 36 credits

Senior Thesis: Required

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

Average Class Size: 15

#18 Best Honors College

Rutgers University Honors College

New Brunswick, NJ

About: A state-of-the-art Honors College, students have opportunities from the very beginning, including exposure to research, extensive collaboration with fellow students and faculty, and even one-on-one discussions with live-in faculty to share ideas. Students collaborate in the high-tech seminar rooms, in the Innovation Lab, and in the many lounges and study areas throughout the building. They also have on-site academic advising and administrative support.

Professional Outcomes: Upon graduation, 82% of Class of 2022 grads had secured a first job or were heading to an advanced degree program. 67% headed directly to the world of employment, where the companies hiring the largest number of grads included Amazon, Johnson & Johnson, L’Oréal, and JP Morgan Chase. Investment banks like Goldman Sachs and Citi also employ hundreds of alumni, as do companies like Verizon, Bristol-Meyers Squibb, Novartis, Pfizer, and Google. The median starting salary across all majors was $70,000.

Honors Enrollment: 2,000

Honors % (of student body): 5.5%

SAT (Average): 1490

ACT (Average): 33

Required Honors Courses: 8 courses

Senior Thesis: Offered

Priority Registration: No

Honors Housing: Yes

Average Class Size: 10-50

#19 Best Honors College

University of Oregon Clark Honors College

Eugene, OR

About: The Robert D. Clark Honors College offers a small, liberal arts college experience with the added benefit of a major research university and its cutting-edge research faculty and facilities. Our small, discussion-based class sizes – capped at 19 – allow students to develop one-on-one relationships with faculty members, and you’ll learn with CHC students from majors across the UO campus. At the Honors College, there is a clear pathway toward involvement in hands-on research, along with access to internships and other career opportunities.

Professional Outcomes: Members of the Class of 2022 already had their next destination lined up at graduation with 78% already employed or entering graduate school. For 73% of that group, their outcomes related directly to the degree that they had just completed. More than 1,000 Oregon alumni work for Nike, and hundreds of others occupy offices at Intel, Amazon, Microsoft, Adidas, Google, Apple, and Salesforce. The median starting salary for a 2022 graduate was $51,000.

Honors Enrollment: 1,360

Honors % (of student body): 7%

SAT (Average): 1340

ACT (Average): 28

Required Honors Credits: 30

Senior Thesis: Required

Priority Registration: Yes

Housing: Yes

Average Class Size: 19

#20 Best Honors College

City University of New York (Macaulay Honors College)

New York, NY:

About: Macaulay Honors College at CUNY is a highly selective college where New York’s most promising students receive the financial and academic support to realize their leadership potential. Macaulay students receive a tuition scholarship, funding for experiential learning, personalized advising by dedicated staff, internship opportunities with nearly 600 organizations, and an opportunity to work CUNY professors on research projects across dozens of academic disciplines.

Outcomes: Many Macaulay graduates continue their education, going on to earn a master’s degree, a professional degree such as medicine or law, or a doctoral degrees. Others decide to begin their careers immediately, and work across a wide spectrum of market sectors, the arts, entrepreneurship, public service, or work overseas. Nearly 250 Macaulay alumni are winners of prestigious awards like the Rhodes, Fulbright, and Truman. Nearly 90 percent of all Macaulay students graduate debt free.

Honors Enrollment: 2,100

Required Honors Credits: 30

Senior Thesis: Required

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: No

#21 Best Honors College

University of Delaware Honors College

Newark, DE

About: The University of Delaware Honors College provides opportunities for academically talented and motivated students to take advantage of the resources of a major research institution while maintaining the feel and attention of a much smaller university. Students in the UD Honors College will have opportunities to lead class discussions, conduct innovative research, and write papers worthy of publication and tackling some of the most challenging topics in your major and beyond. Additional benefits include small honors courses, a living-learning community, close connections with faculty, research funding, honors advisement, and access to an engaged honors alumni network.

Professional Outcomes: 94% of Class of 2022 grads quickly found their next destination. 66% were employed, with 74% taking jobs at for-profit companies, 16% at nonprofits, 7% in K-12 education, and 4% with a government entity. The greatest number of newly minted alums were hired by JPMorgan Chase & Co., KPMG, EY, ChristianaCare, and Deloitte. The median starting salary for this cohort was $62,000. 28% immediately pursued an advanced degree, with 62% entering master’s programs, 20% entering a professional program, and 9% beginning a PhD.

Honors Enrollment: 2,000

Honors % (of student body): 10.6%

SAT (Average): 1360-1490

ACT (Average): 30-34

Required Honors Credits: 18-24

Senior Thesis: Offered

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

Average Class Size: 20-25

#22 Best Honors College

Florida State University (University Honors Program)

Tallahassee, FL

About: The University Honors Program at Florida State University is the only Florida Honors Program with a dedicated cohort of Honors Teaching Faculty, full-time instructors assigned specifically to the program who design the innovative courses they offer. Honors students enjoy ailored courses designed in partnership with faculty across the university to promote critical thinking and inspire innovation, dedicated advisors available daily, two centrally located residence halls for living with like-minded peers, and guaranteed priority registration for classes each term.

Professional Outcomes: Eighty-three percent of job-seeking Seminole grads receive at least one offer of employment within three months of graduation. The top five sectors employing 2022 grads are (in order) finance, technology, marketing, health, and engineering. Roughly one-third of 2022 Florida State grads elected to immediately pursue admission into an advanced degree program; 75% of those who apply receive at least one acceptance. A typical graduating class sees over 100 students accepted into medical schools and over 200 accepted into law schools.

Honors Enrollment: 2,000

Honors % (of student body): 6%

Required Honors Credits: 18

Senior Thesis: Offered

Priority Registration: Yes

Honors Housing: Yes

#23 Best Honors College

University of Maryland Honors College

College Park, MD

About: Combining a close community of diverse students with the singular opportunities of a premier public research university in the nation’s capital area, the Honors College offers a flexible array of eight state of the art living-learning programs. These highly acclaimed programs, innovative and at the frontiers of Honors education, offer exciting exploration of different interdisciplinary areas. Maryland Honors combines the access and care of a small liberal arts college with the vast resources and opportunities of our leading research university. Students take 15-18 credits in one living-learning program in order to earn an Honors Citation, an academic distinction noted on their transcript. Each program’s unique curriculum is designed to fit into the general education requirements already established as part of students’ degree plans.

Professional Outcomes: Within six months of graduating, 96% of Class of 2022 grads had positive outcomes. 67% found employment; the companies/organizations that hired the greatest number of grads included Northrop Grumman, Deloitte, Amazon, and EY. Meta, Apple, and Google employ more than 200 alumni each. The mid-50% salary range for 2022 grads was $55k-$83k. 21% of the Class of 2022 headed directly to graduate and professional school; 11% entered doctoral programs, 5% entered medical school, and 5% entered law school.

Honors Enrollment: 4,200

Honors % (of student body): 13.8%

Required Honors Credits: 15-18

Senior Thesis: Offered

Priority Registration: No

Honors Housing: Yes

#24 Best Honors College

University of Texas at Austin (Plan II Honors Program)
